channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Patent image retrieval using transformer-based deep metric learning
item.description: Intellectual property work covers a wide range of areas.

item.title: Post-Deployment Adaptation with Access to Source Data via Federated Learning and Source-Target Remote Gradient Alignment
item.description: This paper challenges this assumption and introduces FedPDA, a novel adaptation framework that brings the utility of learning from remote data from Federated Learning into PDA.

item.title: Efficacy of Neural Prediction-Based NAS for Zero-Shot NAS Paradigm
item.description: In contrast, handcrafted performance indicators (zero-shot NAS), which use the same architecture with random initialization, can generalize across multiple search spaces.

item.title: Interpreting Sentiment Composition with Latent Semantic Tree
item.description: As the key to sentiment analysis, sentiment composition considers the classification of a constituent via classifications of its contained sub-constituents and rules operated on them.

item.title: Co-evolving Vector Quantization for ID-based Recommendation
item.description: Category information plays a crucial role in enhancing the quality and personalization of recommendations.

item.title: Curvature-based Pooling within Graph Neural Networks
item.description: CurvPool exploits the notion of curvature of a graph to adaptively identify structures responsible for both over-smoothing and over-squashing.

item.title: PointLLM: Empowering Large Language Models to Understand Point Clouds
item.description: The unprecedented advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have created a profound impact on natural language processing but are yet to fully embrace the realm of 3D understanding.

item.title: Can Programming Languages Boost Each Other via Instruction Tuning?
item.description: Results demonstrate that programming languages can significantly improve each other.

item.title: PointOcc: Cylindrical Tri-Perspective View for Point-based 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction
item.description: To address this, we propose a cylindrical tri-perspective view to represent point clouds effectively and comprehensively and a PointOcc model to process them efficiently.

item.title: StyleInV: A Temporal Style Modulated Inversion Network for Unconditional Video Generation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel motion generator design that uses a learning-based inversion network for GAN.

item.title: BioCoder: A Benchmark for Bioinformatics Code Generation with Contextual Pragmatic Knowledge
item.description: BioCoder incorporates a fuzz-testing framework for evaluation, and we have applied it to evaluate many models including InCoder, CodeGen, CodeGen2, SantaCoder, StarCoder, StarCoder+, InstructCodeT5+, and ChatGPT.

item.title: Fine-Grained Cross-View Geo-Localization Using a Correlation-Aware Homography Estimator
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel approach to fine-grained cross-view geo-localization.

item.title: BenchTemp: A General Benchmark for Evaluating Temporal Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To handle graphs in which features or connectivities are evolving over time, a series of temporal graph neural networks (TGNNs) have been proposed.

item.title: Self-pruning Graph Neural Network for Predicting Inflammatory Disease Activity in Multiple Sclerosis from Brain MR Images
item.description: We propose a two-stage MS inflammatory disease activity prediction approach.

item.title: Everything, Everywhere All in One Evaluation: Using Multiverse Analysis to Evaluate the Influence of Model Design Decisions on Algorithmic Fairness
item.description: It is therefore important to make explicit the decisions made during the design of ADM systems and understand how these decisions affect the fairness of the resulting system.

item.title: Simple LLM Prompting is State-of-the-Art for Robust and Multilingual Dialogue Evaluation
item.description: Despite significant research effort in the development of automatic dialogue evaluation metrics, little thought is given to evaluating dialogues other than in English.

item.title: Scalable Incomplete Multi-View Clustering with Structure Alignment
item.description: Although several anchor-based IMVC methods have been proposed to process the large-scale incomplete data, they still suffer from the following drawbacks: i) Most existing approaches neglect the inter-view discrepancy and enforce cross-view representation to be consistent, which would corrupt the representation capability of the model; ii) Due to the samples disparity between different views, the learned anchor might be misaligned, which we referred as the Anchor-Unaligned Problem for Incomplete data (AUP-ID).

item.title: Njobvu-AI: An open-source tool for collaborative image labeling and implementation of computer vision models
item.description: This step is often not compatible with many cloud-based services for marking or labeling image and video data due to limited internet bandwidth in many regions of the world.

item.title: Domain-adaptive Message Passing Graph Neural Network
item.description: Cross-network node classification (CNNC), which aims to classify nodes in a label-deficient target network by transferring the knowledge from a source network with abundant labels, draws increasing attention recently.

item.title: CktGNN: Circuit Graph Neural Network for Electronic Design Automation
item.description: The electronic design automation of analog circuits has been a longstanding challenge in the integrated circuit field due to the huge design space and complex design trade-offs among circuit specifications.

item.title: RGB-T Tracking via Multi-Modal Mutual Prompt Learning
item.description: Object tracking based on the fusion of visible and thermal im-ages, known as RGB-T tracking, has gained increasing atten-tion from researchers in recent years.

item.title: InterDiff: Generating 3D Human-Object Interactions with Physics-Informed Diffusion
item.description: This paper addresses a novel task of anticipating 3D human-object interactions (HOIs).

item.title: Generate Your Own Scotland: Satellite Image Generation Conditioned on Maps
item.description: Despite recent advancements in image generation, diffusion models still remain largely underexplored in Earth Observation.

item.title: MoMA: Momentum Contrastive Learning with Multi-head Attention-based Knowledge Distillation for Histopathology Image Analysis
item.description: Specifically, we employ a student-teacher framework to learn a target model from a pre-trained, teacher model without direct access to source data and distill relevant knowledge via momentum contrastive learning with multi-head attention mechanism, which provides consistent and context-aware feature representations.

item.title: ScrollNet: Dynamic Weight Importance for Continual Learning
item.description: The importance of weights for each task can be determined either explicitly through learning a task-specific mask during training (e. g., parameter isolation-based approaches) or implicitly by introducing a regularization term (e. g., regularization-based approaches).

item.title: Unsupervised CT Metal Artifact Reduction by Plugging Diffusion Priors in Dual Domains
item.description: In this paper, we propose an unsupervised MAR method based on the diffusion model, a generative model with a high capacity to represent data distributions.

item.title: Improving Lens Flare Removal with General Purpose Pipeline and Multiple Light Sources Recovery
item.description: In this paper, we propose a solution to improve the performance of lens flare removal by revisiting the ISP and remodeling the principle of automatic exposure in the synthesis pipeline and design a more reliable light sources recovery strategy.

item.title: Towards Optimal Patch Size in Vision Transformers for Tumor Segmentation
item.description: Although transformers can capture long-range features, their segmentation performance decreases with various tumor sizes due to the model sensitivity to the input patch size.

item.title: Neural Gradient Regularizer
item.description: NGR is applicable to various image types and different image processing tasks, functioning in a zero-shot learning fashion, making it a versatile and plug-and-play regularizer.

item.title: 3D-STMN: Dependency-Driven Superpoint-Text Matching Network for End-to-End 3D Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: In 3D Referring Expression Segmentation (3D-RES), the earlier approach adopts a two-stage paradigm, extracting segmentation proposals and then matching them with referring expressions.

item.title: Illumination Distillation Framework for Nighttime Person Re-Identification and A New Benchmark
item.description: The illumination enhancement branch first estimates an enhanced image from the nighttime image using a nonlinear curve mapping method and then extracts the enhanced features.

item.title: Unsupervised Recognition of Unknown Objects for Open-World Object Detection
item.description: Open-World Object Detection (OWOD) extends object detection problem to a realistic and dynamic scenario, where a detection model is required to be capable of detecting both known and unknown objects and incrementally learning newly introduced knowledge.

item.title: The Power of MEME: Adversarial Malware Creation with Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: However, machine learning models are susceptible to adversarial attacks, requiring the testing of model and product robustness.

item.title: GNFactor: Multi-Task Real Robot Learning with Generalizable Neural Feature Fields
item.description: To incorporate semantics in 3D, the reconstruction module utilizes a vision-language foundation model ($\textit{e. g.}$, Stable Diffusion) to distill rich semantic information into the deep 3D voxel.

item.title: EMDB: The Electromagnetic Database of Global 3D Human Pose and Shape in the Wild
item.description: EMDB is a novel dataset that contains high-quality 3D SMPL pose and shape parameters with global body and camera trajectories for in-the-wild videos.

item.title: Improving Few-shot Image Generation by Structural Discrimination and Textural Modulation
item.description: Furthermore, the frequency awareness of the model is reinforced by encouraging the model to distinguish frequency signals.

item.title: Deontic Paradoxes in ASP with Weak Constraints
item.description: The rise of powerful AI technology for a range of applications that are sensitive to legal, social, and ethical norms demands decision-making support in presence of norms and regulations.

item.title: SharpSAT-TD in Model Counting Competitions 2021-2023
item.description: We describe SharpSAT-TD, our submission to the unweighted and weighted tracks of the Model Counting Competition in 2021-2023, which has won in total $6$ first places in different tracks of the competition.

item.title: Explanations for Answer Set Programming
item.description: Different from xASP, the new system, xASP2, supports different clingo constructs like the choice rules, the constraints, and the aggregates such as #sum, #min.

item.title: Iterative Reward Shaping using Human Feedback for Correcting Reward Misspecification
item.description: Our approach allows the user to provide trajectory-level feedback on agent's behavior during training, which can be integrated as a reward shaping signal in the following training iteration.

item.title: LLaSM: Large Language and Speech Model
item.description: In this work, we propose Large Language and Speech Model (LLaSM).

item.title: Exploring Deep Learning for Full-disk Solar Flare Prediction with Empirical Insights from Guided Grad-CAM Explanations
item.description: This study progresses solar flare prediction research by presenting a full-disk deep-learning model to forecast $\geq$M-class solar flares and evaluating its efficacy on both central (within $\pm$70$^\circ$) and near-limb (beyond $\pm$70$^\circ$) events, showcasing qualitative assessment of post hoc explanations for the model's predictions, and providing empirical findings from human-centered quantitative assessments of these explanations.

item.title: Towards One-Shot Learning for Text Classification using Inductive Logic Programming
item.description: With the ever-increasing potential of AI to perform personalised tasks, it is becoming essential to develop new machine learning techniques which are data-efficient and do not require hundreds or thousands of training data.

item.title: Low-Rank Multitask Learning based on Tensorized SVMs and LSSVMs
item.description: In contrast to previous MTL frameworks, our decision function in the dual induces a weighted kernel function with a task-coupling term characterized by the similarities of the task-specific factors, better revealing the explicit relations across tasks in MTL.

item.title: Benchmarking Multilabel Topic Classification in the Kyrgyz Language
item.description: Kyrgyz is a very underrepresented language in terms of modern natural language processing resources.

item.title: Response: Emergent analogical reasoning in large language models
item.description: In their recent Nature Human Behaviour paper, "Emergent analogical reasoning in large language models," (Webb, Holyoak, and Lu, 2023) the authors argue that "large language models such as GPT-3 have acquired an emergent ability to find zero-shot solutions to a broad range of analogy problems."

item.title: Improving Underwater Visual Tracking With a Large Scale Dataset and Image Enhancement
item.description: The method has resulted in a significant performance improvement, of up to 5. 0% AUC, of state-of-the-art (SOTA) visual trackers.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Modalities Fusion in Sequential Recommendation Systems
item.description: We propose a graph-based approach (named MMSR) to fuse modality features in an adaptive order, enabling each modality to prioritize either its inherent sequential nature or its interplay with other modalities.

item.title: SHARP Challenge 2023: Solving CAD History and pArameters Recovery from Point clouds and 3D scans. Overview, Datasets, Metrics, and Baselines
item.description: In this paper, we define the proposed SHARP 2023 tracks, describe the provided datasets, and propose a set of baseline methods along with suitable evaluation metrics to assess the performance of the track solutions.

item.title: Calibrated Explanations for Regression
item.description: This paper introduces an extension of a feature importance explanation method, Calibrated Explanations (CE), previously only supporting classification, with support for standard regression and probabilistic regression, i. e., the probability that the target is above an arbitrary threshold.
